<h2>Why Should You Get a Masters in Artificial Intelligence?</h2>

<p>The <a href="https://www.weforum.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">World Economic Forum</a> predicts that by 2025, AI will displace about 85 million existing jobs and add 97 million more. With a master's in artificial intelligence, you can take advantage of fast-growing jobs created as a result of breakthroughs in AI. That said, there are both pros and cons to earning this graduate degree.</p>

<div class="grid lg:grid-cols-2 gap-5 my-8"> 
  
<div class="bg-white border-tertiary border rounded-lg shadow-md pt-1 pb-4 px-6">
<h3><sonic-icon icon="check" size="medium" type="solid" color="#457E76"></sonic-icon>Pros</h3>
<ul>
<li>Freedom to pursue highly sought-after job opportunities</li>
<li>Advance your theoretical and practical knowledge of AI with the possibility of focusing on a specialized area</li>
<li>A good return on your investment</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="bg-white border-secondary border rounded-lg shadow-md pt-1 pb-4 px-6">
<h3><sonic-icon icon="x" size="medium" type="solid" color="#C8431D"></sonic-icon>Cons</h3>
<ul>
<li>A master's degree requires a time commitment of 1-2 years and you may not always have online course options.</li>
<li>Graduate school is often as expensive as ab undergraduate degree and not every program offers funding.</li>
<li>The challenging coursework requires a lot of discipline and perseverance</li>
</ul>
</div>

</div>


<h2>What Jobs Can You Get With a Master's in Data Science?</h2>

<p>Careers in artificial intelligence remain in high demand. A master's in artificial intelligence offers the opportunity to compete for carers in a variety of computer science areas. We discuss three possible careers below.</p>

<h3>Data Scientist</h3>

<p>Data scientists are data experts who work in private industries and government agencies. They examine data and draw insights to provide business solutions. Through data analysis, they can identify potential risks and notify stakeholders.</p>

<p>Data scientists implement statistics learning methods. This role requires proficiency in programming languages such as Matlab, R, Python, SQL.</p>

<ul>
<li><strong>Required Education: </strong>Bachelor's degree, if not a master's or doctoral degree</li>
<li><strong>2022 Median Annual Salary: </strong>$103,500</li>
<li><strong>Job Outlook (2022-32):</strong> +35%</li>
</ul>

<h3>Machine Learning Engineer</h3>

<p>Machine learning engineers design, build, and implement machine learning models. They also monitor and retain production models, solve issues in natural language processing, and fix engineering issues. The position requires staying up to date on trends and new technologies. In addition, machine learning engineers collaborate with other engineers to build models that detect cybersecurity risks.</p>

<ul>
<li><strong>Required Education: </strong>Bachelor's degree, or preferably a master's degree for seniors positions</li>
<li><strong>2023 Average Annual Salary: </strong>$115,500</li>
</ul>

<h3>Robotics Engineer</h3>

<p>Robotics engineers automate tasks in a variety of industries. From robotic surgical tools to underwater robotic systems, these professionals can build and test various robotic systems. Work settings may include private manufacturers, automotive industries, or farming. They may focus on the hardware and/or software side of robotics.</p>

<ul>
<li><strong>Required Education: </strong>Bachelor's degree or a master's degree for senior-level positions</li>
<li><strong>2023 Average Annual Salary:</strong> $91,760</li>
<li><strong>Job Outlook (2022-32): </strong>+2-4%</li>
</ul>

<h2>Frequently Asked Questions about Artificial Intelligence</h2>

<h3>Why is artificial intelligence important?</h3>

<p>From banking to retail, many industries have adopted AI to automate human tasks and boost productivity and efficiency. For companies, AI can reduce costs and detect fraud.</p>

<p>Every day, AI helps make our lives easier with self-driving cars, self-cleaning litter boxes, voice commands, and security cameras. That said, the effect of AI on employment remains to be seen.</p>

<h3>How is artificial intelligence used?</h3>

<p>Many industries have adopted artificial intelligence to automate redundant tasks. In medicine, AI sometimes takes on the work of diagnosing patients and transcribing medical documents. Paired with robotics and machine learning, AI can help surgeons during operations to make clinical decisions.</p>

<p>By leveraging data, AI models can train on and improve performing various tasks, including detecting credit card fraud. Even in our daily lives, we encounter AI technology on popular apps like Instagram, where AI algorithms suggest relevant accounts for users to follow. Whether in healthcare, finance, or social media, AI's pervasive presence continues to transform industries and enhance user experiences.</p>

<h3>How do you use artificial intelligence?</h3>

<p>You likely use artificial intelligence every day, by interacting with chatbots when you need customer service help or requesting the weather on Siri, Alexa, or Google Assistant. Streaming platforms such as Netflix use AI algorithms to make personalized content recommendations based on your previous usage.</p>

<p>AI enhances homes by using data on your preferences to adjust lighting and set thermostats, while in e-commerce, it personalizes your experience by recommending purchases based on your browsing history.</p>

<h2 id="why-study-masters-in-artificial-intelligence-in-the-usa" style="line-height: 1.1;"><strong>Why Study Masters in Artificial Intelligence in the USA?</strong></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The United States has risen as a premier destination for aspiring AI masters, but what truly makes it a dreamland? Let’s take a deeper dive into the reasons:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><strong>Innovative Curriculum:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> US universities boast innovative and rigorous AI Master’s programs. They go beyond theoretical foundations, incorporating advanced research and practical applications, often taught by leading experts in the field. This ensures students stay at the forefront of the rapidly evolving AI field.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><strong>Abundant Job Opportunities:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> The demand for AI specialists in the US far exceeds the supply. The </span><a href="https://www.bls.gov/ooh/computer-and-information-technology/home.htm"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Bureau of Labor Statistics</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> projects 682,800 new jobs for computer and information sciences, including AI, over the next decade, representing a 15% increase. This translates to lucrative career options for AI Master’s graduates.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><strong>Unparalleled Growth and Salary Potential:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> The AI engineer market is booming, with a projected 21% growth from 2021 to 2031, significantly higher than the 5% average for other occupations. This exceptional demand translates to competitive salaries, with the average AI engineer in the US earning an impressive $148,710 per year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Intrigued? Now, let’s explore what your Master’s in AI in the US could look like.</span></p>
<p class="suggested-blog-block-itr-1 suggested-blog-block"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> </span><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/masters-in-computer-science-in-usa"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Master’s in Computer Science in the USA</span></a></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">One goal, three paths! The US boasts some of the world’s leading programs, offering you three distinct Master’s options: MASc, MEng, and MS. But before diving in, let’s explore what each path entails.</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><strong>Duration: </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">Your AI Master’s journey in the US will take 1-2 years, depending on your chosen program and university.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><strong>Content:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> AI Master’s programs explore topics like Computational Learning, Intelligent Systems, Algorithm Design and analysis, and Software Engineering.  Remember, the specific content may vary depending on your program and university.</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><strong>Curriculum:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Master’s programs in the USA typically span 30 credit hours, equipping you with a comprehensive framework in one of four key areas:</span></li>
</ul>
<ol>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Computer Vision</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Machine Learning</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Intelligent Interaction</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Knowledge Management and Reasoning</span></li>
</ol>
<p><br><span style="font-weight: 400;">Still searching for the perfect university? They’ll be your guide throughout your application journey, helping you navigate the process and land your dream spot.</span></p>
<h2 id="eligibility-criteria-and-admission-requirements-for-masters-in-artificial-intelligence-in-usa" style="line-height: 1.1;"><strong>Eligibility Criteria and Admission Requirements for Masters in Artificial Intelligence in USA</strong></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Now that you know what the Master’s degree will look like, let’s take you through the door of admissions. Prepare a checklist of everything you will need to get through this door, or you can find one right here:</span></p>
<h3><strong>Bachelor's Degree</strong></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">To apply for an MS in AI in the USA you need to have a bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) field with a </span><strong>grade score of B or better from an accredited institution</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">. You must provide original translated transcripts too.</span></p>
<h3><strong>GMAT or GRE Scores</strong></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Another important requirement for your Master’s in AI in the US is the</span><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/gmat-exam"><span style="font-weight: 400;"> GMAT</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or </span><a href="https://prep.yocket.com/gre"><span style="font-weight: 400;">GRE </span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">test. The </span><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/gmat-scores-and-result"><span style="font-weight: 400;">GMAT scores</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> vary depending on the type of program and the university you choose. An average score should be between </span><strong>580 to 700</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">. The </span><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/gre-scores-and-result"><span style="font-weight: 400;">GRE scores</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">, on the other hand, range from </span><strong>318 to 329</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">. However, currently, some of the universities have waived this criterion in applications.</span></p>
<h3><strong>English Language Test</strong></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you are a non-native English citizen and have graduated from a non-English-instructed university, you need to have an English language proficiency test score to apply for admission. The minimum scores as per tests are given below</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/toefl-exam"><span style="font-weight: 400;">TOEFL</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: 70 - 100</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/ielts-exam"><span style="font-weight: 400;">IELTS</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: 6.0 - 7.5</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/pte-exam-guide"><span style="font-weight: 400;">PTE</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Minimum 65</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/duolingo-english-test"><span style="font-weight: 400;">DET</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Overall Score of 105</span></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Work Experience</strong></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">One of the top requirements for your Master’s in AI in the USA is work experience. </span><strong>At least two years of experience</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> is required at the time of application. However, not all universities teaching courses in AI have a mandatory requirement. Nevertheless, it is preferred.</span></p>
<h3><strong>Passport and Visa</strong></h3>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">A valid passport and a </span><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/usa-student-visa"><span style="font-weight: 400;">US Student Visa</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> are a must to study MS in Artificial Intelligence in the USA for Indian students. You must have to apply for your student visa </span><strong>at least three months prior to the expected date of your travel to the country</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></p>
<p class="suggested-blog-block-itr-1 suggested-blog-block"> <a href="https://yocket.com/blog/steps-for-student-f1-us-visa" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Everything About F-1 Student Visa for USA</a></p>
<h2 id="documents-required-for-ms-in-ai-in-usa" style="line-height: 1.1;"><strong>Documents Required for MS in AI in USA</strong></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Still have that checklist handy? Good, because you would definitely not want to miss out on the documents you will require for pursuing your Master’s in AI from the US. Here is the list that you will definitely have to add:</span></p>
<ul>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">All previously attended institutions’ transcripts</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">A bachelor's degree</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Statement of Purpose or </span><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/all-about-sop"><span style="font-weight: 400;">SOP</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Letter of Recommendation or </span><a href="https://yocket.com/blog/letter-of-recommendation-lor"><span style="font-weight: 400;">LOR</span></a></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Resume or CV</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Scorecards of entrance tests and ELP</span></li>
<li style="font-weight: 400;" aria-level="1"><span style="font-weight: 400;">A personal statement showing your intent behind opting for a Master’s in Artificial Intelligence in the USA. You must include your specific area of interest and your achievements in it.</span></li>
</ul>

<h2 id="admission-process-for-masters-in-artificial-intelligence-in-usa" style="line-height: 1.1;"><strong>Admission Process for Masters in Artificial Intelligence in USA</strong></h2>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Here’s a step-by-step guide to applying to the best universities for MS in AI in the USA.</span></p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Step 1: </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">Start by making a list of universities that offer MS in AI programs that interest you. Consider factors like program ranking, faculty expertise, research opportunities, location, and cost. You can find helpful rankings from organizations like U.S. News & World Report, QS World University Rankings, and Times Higher Education.</span></li>
<li><strong>Step 2:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Each university will have its eligibility criteria for MS in AI programs. These typically include a bachelor’s degree in a related field, such as computer science, mathematics, or engineering, a strong GPA, and good scores on standardized tests like the GRE or GMAT. Some universities may also require letters of recommendation and a statement of purpose. Start gathering the required documents early in the application process.</span></li>
<li><strong>Step 3: </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">Once you have all of your required documents, you can start submitting your applications. Most universities have online application portals where you can upload your documents and pay the application fee.</span></li>
<li><strong>Step 4:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Some universities may require interviews as part of the application process. These interviews are an opportunity for you to learn more about the program and for the admissions committee to get to know you better.</span></li>
<li><strong>Step 5:</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> If you are accepted to a program, you will receive a conditional offer of admission. This offer will typically be contingent on your completing any outstanding requirements, such as providing financial documentation or passing a language test.</span><strong>Step 7: </strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">Once you have met all of the conditions of your offer, you will need to pay a deposit to secure your place in the program. You will also need to submit any additional required documents, such as your visa application.</span></li>
</ul>

font-size: 1rem;\"\u003EFrom The Desk Of Yocket\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftbody\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftable\u003E\n\u003Ch2 id=\"why-study-masters-in-artificial-intelligence-in-the-usa\" style=\"line-height: 1.1;\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EWhy Study Masters in Artificial Intelligence in the USA?\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe United States has risen as a premier destination for aspiring AI masters, but what truly makes it a dreamland? Let’s take a deeper dive into the reasons:\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EInnovative Curriculum:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E US universities boast innovative and rigorous AI Master’s programs. They go beyond theoretical foundations, incorporating advanced research and practical applications, often taught by leading experts in the field. This ensures students stay at the forefront of the rapidly evolving AI field.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAbundant Job Opportunities:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E The demand for AI specialists in the US far exceeds the supply. The \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.bls.gov\u002Fooh\u002Fcomputer-and-information-technology\u002Fhome.htm\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EBureau of Labor Statistics\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E projects 682,800 new jobs for computer and information sciences, including AI, over the next decade, representing a 15% increase. This translates to lucrative career options for AI Master’s graduates.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EUnparalleled Growth and Salary Potential:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E The AI engineer market is booming, with a projected 21% growth from 2021 to 2031, significantly higher than the 5% average for other occupations. This exceptional demand translates to competitive salaries, with the average AI engineer in the US earning an impressive $148,710 per year.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EIntrigued? Now, let’s explore what your Master’s in AI in the US could look like.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"suggested-blog-block-itr-1 suggested-blog-block\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fyocket.com\u002Fblog\u002Fmasters-in-computer-science-in-usa\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EMaster’s in Computer Science in the USA\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n",blogs_part_2:"\u003Ch2 id=\"course-curriculum-for-masters-in-artificial-intelligence-in-usa\" class=\"suggested-blog-block-itr-0\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECourse Curriculum For Masters in Artificial Intelligence in USA\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EOne goal, three paths! The US boasts some of the world’s leading programs, offering you three distinct Master’s options: MASc, MEng, and MS. But before diving in, let’s explore what each path entails.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDuration: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EYour AI Master’s journey in the US will take 1-2 years, depending on your chosen program and university.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EContent:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E AI Master’s programs explore topics like Computational Learning, Intelligent Systems, Algorithm Design and analysis, and Software Engineering.  Remember, the specific content may vary depending on your program and university.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ECurriculum:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E Master’s programs in the USA typically span 30 credit hours, equipping you with a comprehensive framework in one of four key areas:\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Col\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EComputer Vision\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EMachine Learning\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EIntelligent Interaction\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli style=\"font-weight: 400;\" aria-level=\"1\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EKnowledge Management and Reasoning\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cbr\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EStill searching for the perfect university? Look no further! \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fyocket.com\u002Fpremium?v=2\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EYocket Premium\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E provides personalized, end-to-end counseling by dedicated experts. They’ll be your guide throughout your application journey, helping you navigate the process and land your dream spot.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2 id=\"eligibility-criteria-and-admission-requirements-for-masters-in-artificial-intelligence-in-usa\" style=\"line-height: 1.1;\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EEligibility Criteria and Admission Requirements for Masters in Artificial Intelligence in USA\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ENow that you know what the Master’s degree will look like, let’s take you through the door of admissions. Prepare a checklist of everything you will need to get through this door, or you can find one right here:\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EBachelor's Degree\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ETo apply for an MS in AI in the USA you need to have a bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) field with a \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003Egrade score of B or better from an accredited institution\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E. You must provide original translated transcripts too.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EGMAT or GRE Scores\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EAnother important requirement for your Master’s in AI in the US is the\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fyocket.com\u002Fblog\u002Fgmat-exam\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E GMAT\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E or \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fprep.yocket.com\u002Fgre\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EGRE \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003Etest. The \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fyocket.com\u002Fblog\u002Fgmat-scores-and-result\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EGMAT scores\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E vary depending on the type of program and the university you choose. An average score should be between \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E580 to 700\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E. The \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fyocket.com\u002Fblog\u002Fgre-scores-and-result\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EGRE scores\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E, on the other hand, range from \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E318 to 329\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E. However, currently, some of the universities have waived this criterion in applications.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EEnglish Language Test\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EIf you are a non-native English citizen and have graduated from a non-English-instructed university, you need to have an English language proficiency test score to apply for admission. Nevertheless, it is preferred.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPassport and Visa\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EA valid passport and a \u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fyocket.com\u002Fblog\u002Fusa-student-visa\"\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EUS Student Visa\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E are a must to study MS in Artificial Intelligence in the USA for Indian students. Consider factors like program ranking, faculty expertise, research opportunities, location, and cost. You can find helpful rankings from organizations like U.S. News & World Report, QS World University Rankings, and Times Higher Education.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStep 2:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E Each university will have its eligibility criteria for MS in AI programs. These typically include a bachelor’s degree in a related field, such as computer science, mathematics, or engineering, a strong GPA, and good scores on standardized tests like the GRE or GMAT. Some universities may also require letters of recommendation and a statement of purpose. Start gathering the required documents early in the application process.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStep 3: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EOnce you have all of your required documents, you can start submitting your applications. Most universities have online application portals where you can upload your documents and pay the application fee.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStep 4:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E Some universities may require interviews as part of the application process. These interviews are an opportunity for you to learn more about the program and for the admissions committee to get to know you better.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStep 5:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003E If you are accepted to a program, you will receive a conditional offer of admission. This offer will typically be contingent on your completing any outstanding requirements, such as providing financial documentation or passing a language test.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStep 7: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EOnce you have met all of the conditions of your offer, you will need to pay a deposit to secure your place in the program. You will also need to submit any additional required documents, such as your visa application.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Ch2 id=\"top-universities-in-usa-for-masters-in-artificial-intelligence\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ETop Universities in USA for Masters in Artificial Intelligence\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003EThe world’s growing reliance on AI fuels demand for qualified professionals, and the US boasts numerous universities preparing students for this exciting field. NEW MASTER OF SCIENCE IN ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

CST Graduate Advising Contact Information


Phone: 713-223-7972
Email: cstgrad@uhd.edu

 

Program Description

The Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence program (MSAI) is an application-oriented program that combines theoretical knowledge of AI with hands-on training in AI-specific applications through programming languages such as Python and open-source libraries such as TensorFlow. It is a 30 credit-hour graduate program, in which students study 19 hours of foundational courses with topics in knowledge representation and reasoning, machine learning, deep learning, and cognitive systems. Students also take 9 hours of interdisciplinary application courses such as computer vision, robotics, engineering of AI systems, AI in biomedical, and AI in business intelligence. In the final 3 hours, students will have the opportunity to engage in research with faculty members at UHD and other collaborators of UHD faculty and/or internships with partnering businesses, industry, and government agencies. Students with strong programming and mathematics backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Students with minimal background in programming (one programming course) may have to take UHD's CS 5302. Students with minimal mathematics background (Calculus I) will have to take UHD's MATH 5300. Our curriculum will be a combination of hybrid, face-to-face, and online courses. The face-to-face courses will begin at 5:30 PM. Classes begin Fall 2023.

 

Program Learning Outcomes:

Students who complete the program will be able to:

  • Explore, prepare, and clean data.
  • Transfer data into machine-learning representations of unsupervised, supervised, or reinforcement learning.
  • Design and develop intelligent agents and expert systems that receive percepts from the environment and perform actions.
  • Communicate and summarize AI solutions in written, oral, and visual form.

Degree Requirements

The Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence degree requires a minimum of 30 graduate semester credit hours. Courses are offered in a variety of course modes ranging from hybrid, face-to-face, and online. However, the entire degree cannot be completed online.

Required Courses

 (21 hours)
CS 5310 Data Mining
CS 5332 Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
CS 6304 Deep Learning
CS 6310 Natural Language Processing
CS 6305 Computer Vision
CS 6332 Advanced Artificial Intelligence
CS 6382 or CS 6380/6399 Capstone in last semester

Elective Courses
(9 hours)
CS 6307 Cognitive Systems
CS 6308 AI in Biomedical
CS 6311 AI in Business Intelligence
CS 6309 Intelligent Interactive Systems
CS 6331 Robotics Process Automation
CS 6394 Ethics in Artificial Intelligence

For course descriptions please see the Graduate Catalog.

Application Deadlines:

Fall 2024 US residents July 15  and International May 1

Admission Requirements:

Admission to the UHD MSAI program is based upon the applicant's scholastic ability, motivation, and potential for success. These attributes will be assessed through the submission of the following documents to the Office of Graduate & International Admissions at gradadmissions@uhd.edu

 

 

Applicants seeking admission will provide the following application materials for review by the Graduate Curriculum Committee. Please submit all documents to the Graduate Admissions office at gradadmissions@uhd.edu :

  • A completed SLATE application (Click on Apply Now below).
  • Submit (1,000 words or less) a personal statement that addresses why you want to pursue a master's in artificial intelligence.
  • Bachelor's degree conferred by a regionally accredited institution.
  • Official University transcript(s) from which the applicant earned a Bachelor's degree and an advanced degree (if applicable) indicating:
    • the last 60 semester credit hours of coursework and evidence of Bachelor's degree awarded and the GPA. As admission to the degree program is competitive, candidates with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher will be preferred.
  •  Students with an international transcript must submit their transcripts to UHD already evaluated for U.S. equivalency. Here is a list of approved agencies. If residential applicants are experiencing any delays in submitting their official transcript, we will currently accept unofficial transcripts indicating a Bachelor's degree conferred as part of the completion of the application.
  • Complete the following foundation courses (or the equivalent) prior to entering the master's program:
    • CS 5302 – Python for Data Analytics (Prereq one programming course)
    • MATH 5300 - Foundations of Graduate Mathematics (Prereq Calculus I) 
  • Waiver for the Foundation courses is available for those who have completed two courses in Python (for example, CS 1311 and CS 2311 at UHD), linear algebra (for example, MATH 2307 or MATH 2422 at UHD), and probability (for example, MATH 3302 at UHD) or their equivalent with a grade of B or better.
  • Graduate Record Exam (GRE) Waiver can be requested for applicants with a GPA above 3.0 in their last 60 hours of college coursework. The last 60 hours GPA must be counted with all attempted course grades including repeats and not just the highest grades.
  • Resume documenting any work experience that emphasizes personal and professional accomplishments.
  • Two references from individuals well-acquainted with your work and who are able to address your academic potential, for example, work supervisors and professors. Recommenders may either write a letter or complete the MSAI Application Reference Form.
  • Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) score, if you are a graduate of a university where English is not the primary language of instruction (preferred TOEFL scores are: an Internet-based score of 81, a paper-based score of 553 or an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher). As a waiver to these English Proficiency Exams, the College of Sciences & Technology Graduate Studies office will accept as proof of English proficiency, full-time employment history of at least 3 years in a country where English is the primary language spoken, such as the US, UK, Canada, etc. Please submit the English Proficiency Waiver Form as part of your application documents to the Graduate Admissions office.

Admission Process:
The Graduate Advisory Committee will evaluate applications using a matrix based on GPA, GRE score, relevant coursework or experience, recommendations, and other written materials in the applicant's file. The Graduate Advisory Committee will use the results of this evaluation to determine if an applicant is admitted. The Graduate Coordinator will notify students, in writing, of the committee's decision. If an applicant wishes to appeal their admissions decision, can do so here: CST Graduate Admissions Appeal Form. Application opens on September 5
